Module com.example.project3
Package com.example.project3

Class AccountDatabase

java.lang.Object
com.example.project3.AccountDatabase
public class AccountDatabase extends Object
Account Database performs the actions on the array of accounts (i.e open, close, find, sort, etc.)
Author:
Palak Singh, Daniel Guan

      Finding a specific account in the array
      Parameters:
      account - we are trying to find in the array
      Returns:
      int index at which the account is present, -1 if the event is not found

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Adds 4 additional spots at the end of the list of accounts

    • contains

      public boolean contains(Account account)
      Checks to see if a given account is in the account list
      Parameters:
      account - that we are looking for in the account list
      Returns:
      boolean true is the account is found, false if the account is not in the account list

    • open

      public boolean open(Account account)
      Adds the account to the next null space If there is no space left, it grows 4 more spaces and then adds to the list
      Parameters:
      account - that we want to add to the array
      Returns:
      true once the event is successfully added to the list

    • close

      public boolean close(Account account)
      Removing a given account from the account list
      Parameters:
      account - that we are trying to close
      Returns:
      true if the method removes the event, false if even doesn't exist in the list

    • withdraw

      public boolean withdraw(Account account)
      Withdraws an amount from the balance of the account
      Parameters:
      account - we want to withdraw, account.balance being the amount we want to withdraw
      Returns:
      boolean, true if the withdrawal was successful, false if balance will become negative

    • deposit

      public boolean deposit(Account account)
      Deposit money into an account
      Parameters:
      account - to accept the deposit, account.balance being the amount we want to deposit

    • print

      private String print()
      Accounts are printed out just as they appear in the list
      Returns:
      String toprint which the list of all the accounts

      private void swap(int a, int b)
      Swaps two accounts in the array, given the two indices you want to swap

    • sortAccounts

      private void sortAccounts()
      Sorts the account based on type and then profile

    • printSorted

      public String printSorted()
      Prints the accounts organized by account type and profile
      Returns:
      String sortedlist which includes the list of all accounts sorted by account type

    • printFeesAndInterests

      public String printFeesAndInterests()
      Prints out all the accounts with their associated fees and interests Sorts the account before printing in case any new accounts had been added since the last sort
      Returns:
      String feesAndInterest that includes a sorted list of all the accounts with their fees and interests

    • printUpdatedBalances

      public String printUpdatedBalances()
      Prints out the accounts with their updated balances Sorts the account before printing in case any new accounts had been added since the last sort
      Returns:
      String updatedAccounts that includes sorted list of all accounts after the fees and interests have been applied
